docs.snippet: Italy's highest court upheld guilty verdicts Tuesday against the final three U.S. defendants in the 2003 extraordinary rendition kidnapping of an Egyptian terror suspect....
docs.lead_paragraph: Italy's highest court upheld guilty verdicts Tuesday against the final three U.S. defendants in the 2003 extraordinary rendition kidnapping of an Egyptian terror suspect.

headline.main: Italy Upholds Last US Convictions in Rendition
headline.print_headline: Italy Upholds Last US Convictions in Rendition

docs.snippet: Kitty Genovese's screams for help couldn't save her on the night she was murdered outside her apartment in 1964. Fifty years later, those screams still echo, a symbol of urban breakdown and city dwellers' seeming callousness toward their neighbors...
docs.lead_paragraph: Kitty Genovese's screams for help couldn't save her on the night she was murdered outside her apartment in 1964. Fifty years later, those screams still echo, a symbol of urban breakdown and city dwellers' seeming callousness toward their neighbors.

headline.main: 50 Years Later, New York Murder Still Fascinates
headline.print_headline: 50 Years Later, New York Murder Still Fascinates

docs.snippet: A man recently released from prison after a Missouri court overturned his conviction in a sports editor's death is seeking $100 million in damages in a federal civil rights lawsuit against seven police detectives, a prosecutor turned judge and a f...
docs.lead_paragraph: A man recently released from prison after a Missouri court overturned his conviction in a sports editor's death is seeking $100 million in damages in a federal civil rights lawsuit against seven police detectives, a prosecutor turned judge and a former police chief.

headline.main: $100M Civil Rights Suit Filed in Missouri Slaying
headline.print_headline: $100M Civil Rights Suit Filed in Missouri Slaying
